intro: Ditaxis salina, commonly known as the saltbush, is a halophyte plant adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant typically grows in arid and coastal regions where soil salinity is high. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale in color. Ditaxis salina plays an important role in stabilizing soil and preventing erosion in saline habitats.
